Video list auto playback made simple, specially built for RecyclerView

\tIn this sample, we learn how to implement very simple Video ViewHolder and Video list and add Toro support into the App.\n\n \tThere are 2 types of components here: normal ViewHolder (shows no Videos) and video ViewHolder (will have a Video). Here we can see that by correctly implementing Toro\'s core components, we could reduce a lot of time on Video.

\tThis basic example is similar to Basic Sample 1. Additionally, we have a feature to tell Toro which is the first Video we want to play. Until that Video is prepared and start playing, no other Videos is allowed to play.

\tThis basic example is similar to Basic Sample 1. Additionally, we enable interaction with Video View. On single click, we temporarily pause the playback and show an AlertDialog, after we close that dialog, we resume the playback. We also provide custom feedback on long press too. \n\nFurthermore, we add the ability to selective react to click event: we have different response on the View user clicked.
\tThis example is similar to Basic Sample 1. But we add more complicated state listening event. So that we could see how ToroPlayer\'s callback works in practice.
Advance Sample 1: Custom LayoutManager, Stateful playback
\tThis example is similar to Average Sample 1. This time, we use a custom LayoutManager (here I use CarouselLayoutManager) and implement ToroLayoutManager to get native support from Toro.

\tThis example introduce a Facebook-alike timeline, with mixed contents of Text and Videos. A click event to a Video will bring a \'Video list\' where requested Video is played as well as many suggested Videos.

In this sample, we learn how to implement very simple Video ViewHolder and Video list and add Toro support into the App.

 	There are 2 types of components here: normal ViewHolder (shows no Videos) and video ViewHolder (will have a Video). Here we can see that by correctly implementing Toro's core components, we could reduce a lot of time on Video.

 	This sample use the legacy VideoView.

In this sample, we learn how to use the extended benefit or Toro.

 	The list will automatically scroll to next Player and trigger the playback.

 	A long click is handled to support more ideas in your Application.
